title: Calories in a Slice of Bacon
meta_description: Discover calories in slice of bacon, including fat, protein, sodium details, per-slice basis, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in a Slice of Bacon
assumptions: One average slice of pork bacon (~8 g cooked weight), pan-fried until crisp, no added seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut thickness, cooking method, and curing; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A single slice of cooked bacon provides ~43 kcal, mostly from fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Turkey bacon slice instead of pork

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal for a standard cooked pork bacon slice.

faqs.q: Is bacon high in fat or protein?
faqs.a: Mostly fat (3.3 g per slice), with 3 g protein; low carbs.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in a slice of bacon?
faqs.a: Around 192 mg per slice, due to curing process.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Pan-frying renders fat, slightly lowering calories vs. raw; baking similar.

faqs.q: How does turkey bacon compare calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Lower at ~23 kcal per slice, leaner alternative to pork bacon.
